: : LOANS OBTAINED FROM STATE BANKS BY GOVERNMENT : DETAILS 0608/08 1. ( ) (The Hon. Gamini Jayawickrama Perera) , (2) :
asked the Minister of Finance and Planning, : (a) Will he inform this House

(i) separately, the amount of loans taken from state banks by the Government which was in power prior to the dissolution of Parliament in the year 2001; and (ii) separately, the years in which the aforesaid loans were taken? (b) Will he state (i) whether the Government which came to power at the general election held in the year 2001, completed the repayment of the aforesaid loans which were taken from state banks; (ii) if the payment was not completed, the outstanding amount of bank loans with relevance to the tenure of the aforesaid Government; and (iii) separately, with reference to each year during the period from the year 2004 up to now, the amount of loans obtained from state banks by the Government which came to power at the general election that was held in the year 2004? (c) If not, why?

( - , , ) (The Hon. Ranjith SiyambalapitityaMinister of State Revenue and Finace AND Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning) () (i) 2001 1 . (2001 10 . 2001 05 , 2001 19 ). 1 2001 71,227 30,780 102,007 (ii) 1996 2001 2 . 2 1996 -8,208 1997 14,276
asked the Minister of Indigenous Medicine, : (a) Will he inform this House

(i) the number of doctors who practice the indigenous Siddha system of medicine which is a system of medicine specific to the Tamil people, and are serving in Government hospitals (including the Provincial Health Service) at present; and (ii) the names of those hospitals?

(b) Will he sate (i) the number of the aforesaid Siddha doctors that are required for the Government hospitals (including the Provincial Health Service) as identified by the surveys; (ii) whether the required number of Siddha doctors have been appointed to identified Divisional Secretaries Divisions with a high population of Tamil people; and (iii) the period of time within which the steps would be taken to appoint Siddha doctors for all areas including the areas liberated by the security forces? (c) If not, why?
GOVERNMENT HOSPITALS : YUNANI DOCTORS 0645/08 3. ( ) (The Hon. Thilakaratne Withanachchi) - (3) : () ( ) ? () ? () (i) 23 23 ; (ii) , , ; (iii) ( ) ; ? () ? () ? : () ( ) ?

() , ? asked the Minister of Indigenous Medicine: (a) Will he submit to this House together with the names of the relevant hospitals, the number of Yunani Doctors who follow an indigenous system of medicine which is unique to the Muslim Community and are serving at Government hospitals (including the Provincial Health Service) at present? (b) Will he inform this House of the number of Yunani doctors required, as identified by surveys? (c) Will he admit that (i) if 23 Divisional Secretaries Divisions have been identified as areas where a large population of Muslims live, the number of Yunani doctors required is also 23; (ii) three separate Ayurveda, Siddha and Yunani doctors are required for certain Divisional Secretaries Divisions with approximately equal populations of Sinhala, Tamil and Muslim communities; and (iii) Yunani doctors have not been appointed even for medical centres in certain areas with a Muslim majority (for example Batticaloa)? (d) Will he state the period of time within which steps will be taken to provide employment for the Yunani doctors who pass out from Medical Colleges annually and make the necessary treatment available for Muslim patients? (e) If not, why?

() , ? asked the Minister of Finance and Planning: (a) Will he inform this House for the last five years to date (i) the total population of the country; (ii) the religious composition of the above population; and (iii) the racial composition of the above population? (b) Will he submit a breakdown of the age groups of the population for the last four years as, 0 to 20 years 20 to 40 years 40 to 60 years 60 years and above, separately? (c) If not, why?

BANK OF CEYLON AND PEOPLES BANK : PROFIT

asked the Minister of Finance and Planning : (a) Will he inform this House, for the last five years on a per year basis, the profit of the Bank of Ceylon and Peoples Bank separately? (b) Will he state for the last four years on a per year basis, (i) the net asset value of each bank; (ii) the amount that has been provided as doubtful debt and written off as bad debts by each bank; and (iii) the names of bad debt clients? (c) Will he also state for the last five years for each bank on yearly basis, (i) the net cost of borrowings; and (ii) cost to earnings and the number of staff members? (d) If not, why?

( ) (The Hon. Ranjith Siyambalapititya) . . . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) . : . . . . : SLCTB AND RAILWAY DEPARTMENT : INCOME AND EXPENDITURE

asked the Minister of Transport, : (a) Will he inform this House of (i) the income generated by the Sri Lanka Central Transport Board and the Department of Railways from transporting passengers on 09.07.2008; and (ii) the amount of money expended by the Sri Lanka Central Transport Board and the Department of Railways for transporting passengers on that day? (b) Will he state (i) the income generated by the Sri Lanka Central Transport Board and the Department of Railways from transporting passengers on 10.07.2008; and (ii) the amount of money expended by the Sri Lanka Central Transport Board and the Department of Railways for transporting passengers on that day? (c) If not, why?

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Nipunaarachchi) , . ( ) (The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena) , , , , . . . Question ordered to stand down. : : SRI LANKA CENTRAL TRANSPORT BOARD : CORRUPTION AND FROUDS 0899/08 15.

asked the Minister of Transport,- (1) : (a) Is he aware that Divaina Newspaper of 03rd September, 2008 reported that the relevant Minister has mentioned that large scale corruption and frauds have taken place in purchasing spare parts to the Sri Lanka Central Transport Board (SLCTB)? (b) Will he admit that, (i) it has been stated that certain depot managers and regional managers have had deals with spare parts dealers; and

(ii) the above- mentioned newspaper had reported that documents that indicate a purchase of goods worth Rs. 82 million had been found whereas Sri Lanka Central Transport Board (SLCTB) had purchased a stock of goods worth Rs. 1.4 million from a certain supplier? (c) Will he inform this House the names of the depot managers and regional managers connected with the aforesaid corruption and frauds? (d) Will he state the legal action that has been taken with regard to the aforesaid depot managers and m? (e) If not, why?

12. . ( . . ) ( . - . . - ) (The Hon. M. Joseph Michael Perera on behalf of The Hon. R. M. Ranjith Madduma Bandara) - (2) : () (i) , , 26 . . 2007.04.27 2007 - ; (ii) 2000 2005 , / ; ? () ? () ? () ? : () (i) , , 26 . . 2007.04.27 2007 ,

asked the Minister of Education: (a) Is he aware that (i) Mrs. S.A. Sumithra Kumari Surasena of No. 26, Pemaduwa, Anuradhapura faced the interview that was held on 27.04.2007 at the Anuradhapura Zonal Education Office for the recruitment of voluntary teachers - 2007; and (ii) she served as a voluntary teacher at Anu/Kimbulwewa Ananda Vidyalaya, Tantirimale from the year 2000 to the year 2005? (b) Will he admit that Mrs. Surasena has fulfilled the basic educational qualifications required for this post? (c) Will he take the necessary steps to grant her an appointment as a voluntary teacher? (d) If not, why?

Subscriptions : The annual subscription for Official Report of Hansard is Rs. 2,178. A single copy of Hansard is available for Rs. 18.15. (Postage Rs. 2.50) Copies can be obtained by remitting in advance an annual subscription fee to the SUPERINTENDENT, GOVERNMENT PUBLICATIONS BUREAU, No. 132, Maya Avenue, Kirulapone, Colombo 5. The fee should reach him on or before November 30 each year . Late applications for subscriptions will not be accepted.
